div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 09:53 am CDT

div.div: Mostly sunny, with a high near 74. Windy, with a north northwest wind 22 to 29 mph, with gusts as high as 40 mph.
Mostly clear, with a low around 46. Windy, with a north northwest wind 20 to 25 mph decreasing to 8 to 13 mph after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 36 mph.
Mostly sunny, with a high near 73. North wind 6 to 10 mph.

div.p:
Mandatory Senior Class meeting Sunday evening 8:30 pm on google meets. We need all Seniors in attendance. Graduation plan and end of year procedures to be discussed.
Sayre Schools will honor the Graduating Class of 2020 with a parade on Friday, May 15th at 7:00 pm. The parade will start at the County barn and end on West Main. We ask that all family members, friends, and patrons come . . .

h3.a: School Contact Information During the Closure

div.p:
School contact information during the closure
We are here to serve our students and parents during the closure! If you have any school-related questions or concerns during the closure (April 6th-May 8th), please give us a call or send an e-mail. If you choose to call, dial (580)928-5531 followed by the three-digit extension of the person you are trying to reach. Phone hours are during regular business . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about School Contact Information During the Closure

div.p:
Sayre Schools Distance Learning Plan
Dear Sayre families:
Our administrators, teachers, and instructional support staff are working hard to develop a distance learning plan that will help our students finish the school year strong. As you can imagine, this planning has presented its own set of trials, as most of it has occurred digitally or at a distance, so faculty and staff are protected . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Sayre Schools Distance Learning Plan
Read more about Sayre Schools - FAQ: Closure Questions

div.p: Any 6-12 students that do not have internet access at home need to contact Mr. Coffman or Mr. Bohannon by Monday, March 30th. You can leave a message on school phone or contact through their school email bcoffman@sayre.k12.ok.us or jbohannon@sayre.k12.ok.us

a.aria-label: Read more about NO INTERNET ACCESS

h3.a: Free meals for Sayre kids during the school closure!

div.p:
FREE! Grab n' Go meals for Sayre kids during the school closure!
Tuesday we will be having a muffin & yogurt for breakfast,
hot ham & cheese toaster & fruit for lunch; each meal comes with white milk & a chocolate milk
Sayre Schools is excited to announce that student meals (breakfast and lunch) will be offered free of charge to Sayre children during the state-mandated . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Free meals for Sayre kids during the school closure!

div.p:
Sayre Schools Athletics Facilities Closed
All Sayre Schools facilities (including all buildings, gymnasiums, game fields, practice fields and indoor facilities) are closed for student/team usage as part of the statewide mandated school closure. This includes all individual and team activities at all age levels. Sorry for this inconvenience.

a.aria-label: Read more about Sayre Schools Athletic Facilities Closed

div.p:
To: Parents of High School Juniors
FROM: Sayre ISD
Date: 8/27/2019
Sayre ISD is communicating with parents of students who will be juniors during the 2019-20 school year.
Our school district plans to administer the ACT® test in spring 2020 to eligible juniors as part of the state contract with the Oklahoma State Department of Education and . . .

div.h4: Sayre Schools Bond Proposal: Vote Tuesday, September 10th!

a.aria-label: Read more about SAYRE SCHOOL BOND 2019
